title: 'Thermographic scans gave my son false hope'
description: The family of a young musician who relied on the scans says they didn't warn that his cancer had spread.

title: Coronavirus: ‘Lego helped me get out of bed’
description: Charlotte Tyrer, 25, makes portraits of celebrities to keep herself busy during lockdown.

title: How updating Dolly Parton's Jolene helped Raye find her voice
description: "I feel I've stumbled on a sound," says Raye, whose new single is a modern retelling of Jolene.

title: Egypt desperate to revive coronavirus-hit tourism industry
description: The pandemic brought Egypt's tourism industry to a virtual halt, affecting millions of livelihoods.

title: US election: Do postal ballots lead to voting fraud?
description: President Trump says postal ballots lead to widespread fraud - but what evidence is there?

title: Fertility rate: 'Jaw-dropping' global crash in children being born
description: Nearly every country will see their populations fall as the world has fewer babies.

title: 'Men didn't understand my medicated tampon business'
description: Valentina Milanova launched a tampon with built-in pain relief to take on the multinationals.

title: OnlyFans: 'I started selling sexy photos online after losing my job'
description: The number of people signing up to sell adult content online has spiked during coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus in South Africa: Inside Port Elizabeth's 'hospitals of horrors'
description: A BBC investigation exposes chronic failures in the health system in one of the poorest areas.

title: Could US or UK ban TikTok?
description: With the short-video app already banned in India, Sophia Smith Galer looks at whether the UK or the US could be next.

title: David LaChapelle's London shopfront exhibition opens
description: The photographer's work returns to London on a massive scale.

title: Coronavirus: The last-round fight for NYC's bastions of boxing?
description: With no clear path to reopening, New York's boxing gyms fear they may never return after the pandemic.

title: 'Well I suppose that's one way to train'
description: The Queen speaks to members of the British armed forces about the work that continues at home and overseas.

title: Banksy: New coronavirus-inspired artwork appears on Tube
description: The enigmatic graffiti artist returns to his Underground roots for his new pandemic-inspired piece.

title: How to stop your glasses steaming up with a face mask on
description: Three simple tips to stop your glasses fogging up while you shop with a mask or face covering on.

title: Huawei: What does the ban mean for you?
description: Restrictions on use of Huawei's kit are set to slow down the rollout of 5G and perhaps broadband too.

title: Naya Rivera: Why Glee's Santana was so important to young LGBT women
description: For some LGBT women, the lesbian cheerleader was the first gay woman they'd seen on screen.

title: Andean condor birds 'flap wings just 1% of the time'
description: One bird flew 100 miles in five hours without flapping, research from Swansea University finds.

title: Rochdale grooming: 'Why did I get a criminal record when I was a victim?'
description: A victim of Rochdale grooming gangs says a criminal record has destroyed her hopes of a career.

title: Former GB cyclist Varnish loses employment tribunal appeal
description: Former Great Britain cyclist Jess Varnish loses her employment tribunal appeal against British Cycling.

title: Why is Bale behaving like he is at Real Madrid?
description: Gareth Bale has been pictured fooling around while watching Real Madrid - Guillem Balague explains why the Wales international is playing up and how it has come to this.

title: Coronavirus: Face masks and coverings to be compulsory in England's shops
description: The new rules will apply from 24 July and those failing to comply will face a fine of up to £100.

title: Aztec palace's remains uncovered off Mexico City's main Zócalo plaza
description: The location of ruler Axayácatl's palace was later used by Spanish conquistador Hernán Cortés.

title: Ocado says switch to online shopping is permanent
description: The online grocer saw "years of growth in months" amid the lockdown and says the retail world has changed.

title: UK economy rebounds more slowly than expected
description: The UK's economy grew 1.8% in May as the lockdown began to ease, less than economists had predicted.

title: 'No DSS' letting bans 'ruled unlawful' by court
description: A court rules that refusing to rent to a person because they are on housing benefit is unlawful.

title: US Supreme Court allows federal executions to resume
description: The court clears the way for the first executions of federal prisoners in 17 years.

title: Naya Rivera: Glee cast and other stars pay tribute
description: Lea Michele and Jane Lynch are among those paying respect, after the actress's death was confirmed.

title: Coronavirus: How to talk about conspiracy theories
description: Conspiracy theories have thrived during the pandemic - what's the right way to talk to someone who believes them?

title: 'Hope' and ambition drive UAE's Mars mission
description: The United Arab Emirates is sending a satellite to the Red Planet to study its weather and climate.

title: The Papers: 'About bleedin' time' welcome for masks in shops
description: Most of the papers lead on face coverings becoming mandatory in English shops from 25 July.

title: Gough Whitlam: Queen not told in advance of Australia PM's sacking, letters show
description: Her representative dismissed Gough Whitlam without telling her first, newly released letters show.

title: Winter wave of coronavirus 'could be worse than first'
description: Modelling suggests there could be a deadly second peak, killing more than 100,000 people in the UK.
